0.example: Adithya isn't always the cynosure of the hour, actually wait, he never is

1.example: She looked cherubic in that dress, not to mention that underwear

2.example: He really managed to bungle up this task too? This one was easy!

3.example: His bungling up of tasks is really starting to make me wonder whether he's militating

4.definition: Affected by disease, gruesome, unhealthy state
4.example: He's morbid in appearance, but his bungles are what really start to irk me

5.example: Just a look at him gets me fraught with sadness in our shortlisting criteria

6.example: He's a living, walking, pernicious man who could bring the entire institute down

7.example: Trust me Jim, there's not enough rancor in me to tell that man to pull his shit together

8.example: Jim, listen, we can get rid of him by using this sledgehammer, you can be my unwitting accomplice in this murder, and I'll have only 20 years of jail time

9.definition: State of collapse caused by illness or oldage
9.example: Listen Jim, that indolent man is going to be the reason for this institute's downfall, not decrepitude

10.example: Listen Jim, I know that you're an uxorious man, but getting rid of that gargantuan disappointment is going to be a close second to your best experiences in life

11.example: We could consecrate this entire place just by defenestrating him

12.example: Listen, I'll add a bit of the meds into his coffee, we'll debilitate him, and then we put him in the industry shredder

13.example: Everyday, we have our quotidian of work, and then there's this guy who just sits there and lets the rest of the industry go to hell

14.example: I can do raucous work, easy work, boring work, and even fastidious work, but working with that dolt? Not a chance

15.example: I travail everyday, just to get some hard-earned cash to go back to my family, and then there's that sloth

16.example: The worst part is that his idiocy is unfeigned, like he doesn't even try!

17.example: That corpulent eunuch, I doubt he's seen a gym in his life

18.example: I work in progressive celerity, increasing my speed by the hour

19.definition: To assail with contemptuous or opprobrious language
19.example: What? I'm reviling the guy because he's fat? No, I'm reviling his incompetence! He's clearly challenged

20.example: Alright Jim, I'll be all candor with you, why'd we pick that guy at all? Just look at that heap of flesh

21.example: I'm ungainly with the attitude? Hell, we're not making any gains at all with that guy over there, screw ungainly

22.example: Why's the boss always vaunting that dumb guy anyway, he barely does any work at all!

23.example: I'm starting to feel the ennui hit me, you know

24.example: Hey, why are you getting all maudlin because of my abuses at that guy? They're not even directed at you!

25.example: Wait, what? That guy is your brother, and he has the down syndrome? Was I in oblivion all this time?

26.definition: The substitution of a mild, indirect or vague expression for one thought to be offensive
26.example: The waiters at the restaurant were all given the role of executive attending staff

27.example: The man walked into the bar in a brusque manner, nearly tripping one of the staff and shattering a dozen glasses

28.example: Amy Santiago tried to malinger to avoid going to the office, but Holt thwarted her plan by offering her a ride to the doctor

29.definition: Sharpness, harshness, or bitterness of nature, speech
29.example: Adithya really had no idea how to break the news to them, it was an acrimonious talk that he offered that people viewed with bitterness

30.definition: Having patches of black and white or of other colors; parti-colored
30.example: The litter of puppies was a piebald group, and none of them resembled each other

31.definition: Relating to a practical point of view or practical considerations
31.example: Institutes do it wrong all the time, a pragmatic approach to problem solving teaches children a lot more in a lot less time

32.example: The opponent is going to be redoubtable this time, take care

33.definition: A grotesque or debased likeness or imitation
33.example: In travesty, the boss fired the man who did his job well

34.definition: Habitual observance of truth in speech
34.example: Victoria was great at determining the veracity of a speech and could even tell what was faked in it

35.example: Adithya was a mercurial man when upset and could not think straight at all

36.example: Shanks was a dour man after Ploo left him for PROD

37.definition: Snobbish or having the aloof attitude of a snob
37.example: Every line was picked apart by the persnickety wife

38.definition: To change repeatedly one's attitude or opinions with respect to a cause
38.example: Krishnaraj and Adithya are adept at tergiversating their state when one argument paves the way to victory

39.definition: To prevent the existence; make impossible
39.example: Let's preclude this child, it's a girl afterall

40.example: I told you we should've gotten rid of this vociferous child a long time ago

41.definition: Folkways of central importance accepted without question
41.example: So, you're telling me this ritual is a part of the mores of Hinduism?

42.example: When the police officers questioned the family about their child's death, they showed no compunction whatsoever

43.definition: Leadership or predominant influence exercised by one nation over others
43.example: China attempted to be a hegemony over India, but we don't surrender that quick

44.example: You know it Jim, I'm going to be called since I'm the toady who sucks up to the boss afterall

45.definition: To amend by removing words, passages that are deemed offensive
45.example: If I don't expurgate this text document before I push it to the repository, I might be in a bit of a pickle

46.definition: A false and malicious statement designed to injure the reputation of someone or something
46.example: The reporter swore that this talk would be confidential but the next day, he posted a calumny on the author of the book

47.example: I'm going to doff that dolt out of my company premises

48.definition: Subject to parching or burning heat
48.example: The firefighters barely fought off against the torrid fire from the 4th floor

49.example: The wizened man did not like his appearance at all, he was far too young to end up this way

50.definition: Curious, or unusual in the way that provokes dry amusement
50.example: K-Pop was initially a droll in India, now they have adolescent girls completely hooked to their music

51.definition: A writ ordering a person to attend a court
51.example: John was given a subpoena to address his two divorces

52.definition: A procedure for ending a debate and taking a vote
52.example: Sometimes I just wished that these both invoked a cloture and called it a day

53.definition: Made airtight by fusion or sealing; not affected by outward influence or power
53.example: While known for his grade, he was renowned for his hermetic lifestyle more

54.definition: To reprimand or berate harshly; criticize
54.example: Anuraag is lambasted for his inattentiveness when discussing important matters

55.definition: A strong verbal or written attack on someone or something; art of disputation
55.example: Adithya made a polemic on Sai Pranay for his lack of concern on deadlines for the club

56.definition: Excessively proper or modest in speed, conduct, dress
56.example: At the beginning of the Wandering Inn, Lyonette was a prudish girl, who cared nothing for commoners

57.example: The fact of the matter is that Adithya is an indolence, he barely does any work unless he requested to!

58.definition: A fradulent or ignorant pretender to medical skill
58.example: It is widely agreed that most people who pose as chiropractors are actually quacks

59.definition: A person assisting the celebrant in a religious service or procession
59.example: One can draw a parellel between hindu swamis and their bhakts with cult leaders and their acolytes

60.example: Sometimes going around the bush, Abhiram is a man with limpid interactions with seldom any ulterior motive

61.example: Grsha was a paragon, who excelled at everything she attempted to do

62.definition: Care for and protect in an overindulgent way
62.example: Anuraag cosseted his valheim creations far too much, which made it only easier to kid around with him by breaking them

63.example: Sometimes one does wonder on whether the villains in the stories expiate for the suffering they have caused

64.definition: A series of shots fired or missles thrown all at the same time or in quick succession
64.example: Whenever Krishnaraj attempts to make a poor joke, he receives a fusillade from the entire gang

65.example: Adithya was lachrymose when he realized that his efforts did not warrant an A grade in WAS

66.definition: A body of troops standing in formation
66.example: I saw a phalanx at the gates of the Indo-Pakistani border

67.example: Aravinth was a man who looked at the corporations and responded to it with an umbrage

68.definition: To impair the quality of; make faulty; spoil
68.example: The drink was vitiated when you added the curd into it, what were you thinking?!

69.definition: An extremely happy, peaceful, or picturesque episode or scene
69.example: Adithya would be joyous, whenever he thought of the murgi idyll in Canada

70.definition: used as a substitute, typically an inferior one, for something else
70.example: Developing an ersatz software would be time consuming, and wasteful for corporate time

71.example: Adithya sometimes made gargantuan mistakes by saying too much

72.definition: Flamboyant confidence or style or manner
72.example: Dressing up in bright colors is a panache trait that I'd much rather not have

73.definition: Not to be persuaded, moved or affected by prayers or entreaties
73.example: Sometimes, it's best to surrender your statement, no one likes an inexorable fool who doesn't take defeats well

74.example: Adithya is a narcissistic fool, he rarely cares for the people around him and only wonders about how he'd look to the observer's eye

75.example: While not a person that generally challenges puzzles, Adithya had a love for creating cryptic statements for the murgi clan

76.definition: To convert into or cause to harden like bone to become rigid or inflexible in habits, attitudes, opinions
76.example: Adithya's insecurities only began to ossify once he began losing friends again

77.example: Anuraag's jokes about death at a funeral were largely incongruous

78.definition: Full of menacing or malign influences
78.example: Chad looked at Pogson in a baleful manner before a bowl of cereal fell on his head

79.example: Some people are exhausting to talk to because they're as hidebound as you can get, and don't bother wanting to come out of their safe circle!

80.example: Three out of four people were timorous when given the chance to venture into the woods at night

81.definition: Resisting control or restraint in a difficult manner
81.example: The officers tried to manacle the drunkard, but he was being obstreperous

82.example: The status of the community was deteriorating, and was a poignant affair to Adithya

83.example: Chad almost had it, but Pogson managed to thwart his mission effortlessly

84.definition: Willing to sell one's influence; open to bribery
84.example: The officer looked strict, but he was a venal man so I slipped him some bills

85.definition: To put into a state of agitated confusion
85.example: He was flustered when his intentions were exposed to the committee

86.definition: Pleasing to the eye but deceptive
86.example: Immortals are specious in nature, they are narcissistic and only care for themselves

87.example: The murgi clan is a peerless organization, the likes that the world has never seen

88.definition: Having a disparaging, derogatory, or belitting effect or force

89.example: Adithya was a fractious man when it came to chaos in the organization

90.definition: Surroundings, especially of a social or cultural nature
90.example: Madhavan would be exposed to a new milieu once he heads out for college

91.example: Hey! That man is trying to purloin my wallet!

92.example: There's astute and there's asinine, and then there's you

93.definition: A compulsion to set things on fire
93.example: The pyromaniac teenagers got what they deserved, manacled

94.example: In a DJ party, the last thing you want to see is a staid gentlemen, that's the worst type there is

95.example: The two parties were always inimical, trying to one up each other in every instance of life

96.example: I am really protean, what do I choose? A masters or a job?

97.example: Adithya is rarely mendacious, he doesn't know how to tell a lie and get away with it afterall

98.definition: Able to be forgiven or pardoned

99.example: No matter how much scientists try, all they've managed to come up with are insentient things
